title: Fishing intensity

msy.title: Maximum Sustainable Yield
msy.content: The Maximum Sustainable Yield (MSY) is a term used in fisheries science to measure the sustainability of fish stocks. It is the point at which we can catch as much fish as possible without reducing that fish population below the most productive level. It’s where fish catch is equal to the reproduction rate.

subtitle:
Fishing intensity measured the extent to which a stock is being exploited. This is the fraction of the fish population that is caught in a given year.

Here it's measured as the intensity divided by the intensity at the [maximum sustainable yield](hover::biodiversity::msy) – the level at which we can catch the maximum amount of fish without a decline in fish populations. A value of one is the optimal level to maximize fish catch without declining populations. Greater than one suggests overfishing.
originUrl: I was trying to ask if there are only tsvs in owid-content. What makes explorers work is in owid-grapher, right?

comparisonLines.label: Above this line = fishing pressure is above the maximum sustainable yield
